Arizona Winter School 2023: Unlikely Intersections

AWS 2023 will be held March 4-8, 2023 at the University of Arizona in Tucson, AZ.

Registration will open mid-September and will close on November 15th.

All participants must abide by the University of Arizona nondiscrimination and anti-harassment policy.

Please refer to University of Arizona academic calendars for the tentative dates of future Winter Schools. (The AWS begins on the first day of the University of Arizona's Spring Recess in any given year.)

  • Schedule and other important information
  • Local directions
  • Organizers: Alina Bucur, Anthony Várilly-Alvarado, David Zureick-Brown (main program) with Brandon Levin and Hang Xue.
  • Funded by the National Science Foundation, supported by the National Security Agency, and organized in partnership with the Clay Mathematics Institute.

Courses:

  • SHORTTITLE  Laura DeMarco: Arithmetic dynamics and intersection problems

    • Course and project outline

  • SHORTTITLE  Jonathan Pila: Point-counting and applications

    • Course and project outline

  • SHORTTITLE  Thomas Scanlon: Model theoretic origins and approaches to unlikely intersection problems

    • Course and project outline

  • SHORTTITLE  Jacob Tsimerman: Special point problems and their arithmetic

    • Course and project outline

    with Clay lecturer

  • SHORTTITLE  Boris Zilber
